title: Have NBA Defenses Got Worse Or Have Offenses Got Better?
text:
Code
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

Code
nba_data <- data.frame(
  season = c("1985-86", "1986-87", "1987-88", "1988-89", "1989-90", 
             "1990-91", "1991-92", "1992-93", "1993-94", "1994-95", 
             "1995-96", "1996-97", "1997-98", "1998-99", "1999-00", 
             "2000-01", "2001-02", "2002-03", "2003-04", "2004-05", 
             "2005-06", "2006-07", "2007-08", "2008-09", "2009-10", 
             "2010-11", "2011-12", "2012-13", "2013-14", "2014-15", 
             "2015-16", "2016-17", "2017-18", "2018-19", "2019-20", 
             "2020-21", "2021-22", "2022-23", "2023-24", "2024-25"),
  offense = c(111.3, 113.6, 113.4, 113.8, 112.0, 
              112.6, 113.5, 111.3, 109.7, 113.1, 
              113.2, 112.4, 110.9, 106.6, 106.8, 
              107.0, 110.3, 109.3, 110.4, 112.7, 
              110.2, 112.9, 112.1, 112.4, 113.9, 
              110.2, 110.0, 111.4, 111.3, 111.6, 
              113.5, 114.8, 114.1, 115.0, 115.9, 
              117.3, 116.2, 118.6, 122.2, 121.0),
  defense = c(101.1, 102.2, 101.6, 100.0, 102.9, 
              101.8, 102.6, 98.2, 96.7, 102.3, 
              101.3, 99.2, 97.5, 93.6, 96.4, 
              96.6, 98.1, 96.6, 93.1, 97.8, 
              98.7, 98.8, 98.1, 101.3, 101.9, 
              99.5, 97.5, 99.0, 98.9, 100.4, 
              98.2, 102.9, 103.0, 104.9, 102.5, 
              106.8, 106.2, 109.9, 108.4, 106.6),
  league_avg = c(107.2, 108.3, 108.0, 107.8, 108.1,
                 107.9, 108.2, 108.0, 106.3, 108.3,
                 107.6, 106.7, 105.0, 102.2, 104.1,
                 103.0, 104.5, 103.6, 102.9, 106.1,
                 106.2, 106.5, 107.5, 108.3, 107.6,
                 107.3, 104.6, 105.8, 106.6, 105.6,
                 106.4, 108.8, 108.6, 110.4, 110.6,
                 112.3, 112.0, 114.8, 115.3, 114.5)
)
my_caption <- "basketball-reference  |  By: Aiden Feimer"
nba_data$season <- factor(nba_data$season, levels = nba_data$season)
nba_data_long <- nba_data %>%
  select(season, offense, defense, league_avg) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c("offense", "defense", "league_avg"), 
               names_to = "efficiency_type", 
               values_to = "rating")
ggplot(nba_data_long, aes(x = season, y = rating, group = efficiency_type, color = efficiency_type)) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("offense" = "#1d428a", "defense" = "#c8102e", "league_avg" = "#f58246"),
                    labels = c("offense" = "Best Team Offensive Rating", 
                               "defense" = "Best Team Defensive Rating", 
                               "league_avg" = "League Average")) +
  labs(title = "Have Analytics Ruined The NBA?",
       subtitle = "The NBA Has Turned Into An Analytical Game, Leading To The Best Offenses Ever",
       x = "Season",
       y = "Efficiency Rating",
       color = "Metric",
       caption = my_caption) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 8),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 1, size = 8)
  )


Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.











Code
nba_data <- data.frame(
  decade = factor(c("1980s", "1990s", "2000s", "2010s", "2020s"), 
                 levels = c("1980s", "1990s", "2000s", "2010s", "2020s")),
  threes = c(5.2, 12.1, 16.1, 22.8, 35.3),
  twos = c(83.0, 70.5, 64.5, 53.6, 53.2),
  fts = c(29.4, 26.5, 25.0, 20.5, 22.1),
  possessions = c(100.3, 93.3, 91.3, 95.2, 98.8)
)
threes_min <- 0
twos_min <- 40
fts_min <- 15
possessions_min <- 85
my_caption <- "basketball-reference  |  By: Aiden Feimer"
threes_plot <- ggplot(nba_data, aes(x = decade, y = threes)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#1d428a") +
  labs(title = "3-Point Attempts per Game",
       x = "Decade",
       y = "Attempts per Game") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(threes_min, NA)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 35, hjust = 1)
  )
twos_plot <- ggplot(nba_data, aes(x = decade, y = twos)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#c8102e") +
  labs(title = "2-Point Attempts per Game",
       x = "Decade",
       y = "Attempts per Game") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(twos_min, NA)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 35, hjust = 1)
  )
fts_plot <- ggplot(nba_data, aes(x = decade, y = fts)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#f58246") +
  labs(title = "Free Throw Attempts per Game",
       x = "Decade",
       y = "Attempts per Game") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(fts_min, NA)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 35, hjust = 1)
  )
possessions_plot <- ggplot(nba_data, aes(x = decade, y = possessions)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#666666") +
  labs(title = "Possessions per Game",
       x = "Decade",
       y = "Possessions per Game",
       caption = my_caption) +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(possessions_min, NA)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 35, hjust = 1),
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 1, size = 8)
  )
combined_plot <- grid.arrange(
  threes_plot, twos_plot, 
  fts_plot, possessions_plot, 
  nrow = 2, 
  top = "The Three Ball Is Taking Over"
)











Code
seasons <- c("1984-85", "1985-86", "1986-87", "1987-88", "1988-89", "1989-90", 
             "1990-91", "1991-92", "1992-93", "1993-94", "1994-95", "1995-96", 
             "1996-97", "1997-98", "1998-99", "1999-00", "2000-01", "2001-02", 
             "2002-03", "2003-04", "2004-05", "2005-06", "2006-07", "2007-08", 
             "2008-09", "2009-10", "2010-11", "2011-12", "2012-13", "2013-14", 
             "2014-15", "2015-16", "2016-17", "2017-18", "2018-19", "2019-20", 
             "2020-21", "2021-22", "2022-23", "2023-24", "2024-25")
pace <- c(102.1, 102.1, 100.8, 99.6, 100.6, 98.3, 97.8, 96.6, 96.8, 95.1, 
          92.9, 91.8, 90.1, 90.3, 88.9, 93.1, 91.3, 90.7, 91.0, 90.1, 
          90.9, 90.5, 91.9, 92.4, 91.7, 92.7, 92.1, 91.3, 92.0, 93.9, 
          93.9, 95.8, 96.4, 97.3, 100.0, 100.3, 99.2, 98.2, 99.2, 98.5, 98.8)
ppp <- c(1.085, 1.079, 1.090, 1.086, 1.085, 1.089, 1.087, 1.090, 1.088, 1.067, 
         1.092, 1.084, 1.075, 1.059, 1.030, 1.047, 1.038, 1.053, 1.045, 1.037, 
         1.069, 1.072, 1.074, 1.081, 1.091, 1.083, 1.081, 1.055, 1.066, 1.076, 
         1.065, 1.072, 1.095, 1.093, 1.112, 1.115, 1.130, 1.126, 1.156, 1.159, 1.152)
nba_data <- data.frame(
  Season = seasons,
  Pace = pace,
  PPP = ppp
)
nba_data$Decade <- substr(nba_data$Season, 1, 3)
nba_data$Decade[nba_data$Decade == "198"] <- "1980s"
nba_data$Decade[nba_data$Decade == "199"] <- "1990s"
nba_data$Decade[nba_data$Decade == "200"] <- "2000s"
nba_data$Decade[nba_data$Decade == "201"] <- "2010s"
nba_data$Decade[nba_data$Decade == "202"] <- "2020s"
nba_data$Decade <- factor(nba_data$Decade, 
                         levels = c("1980s", "1990s", "2000s", "2010s", "2020s"))
seasons_to_label <- nba_data %>%
  filter(Season %in% c("1998-99", "2023-24"))
custom_colors <- c(
  "1980s" = "#1d428a",  # Blue
  "1990s" = "#c8102e",  # Red
  "2000s" = "#f58246",  # Orange
  "2010s" = "#666666",  # Gray
  "2020s" = "#06402b"   # Green
)
my_caption <- "basketball-reference  |  By: Aiden Feimer"
ggplot(nba_data, aes(x = Pace, y = PPP)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = Decade), size = 4, alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_color_manual(values = custom_colors, name = "Decade") +
  geom_text(data = seasons_to_label, 
            aes(label = Season), 
            hjust = -0.3, 
            vjust = 0.5,
            size = 3.5,
            fontface = "bold") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Pre-2000 Defenses Wouldn't Be Able To Handle Today's Offenses",
    subtitle = "Teams Today Are Too Efficient For Early NBA Defenses",
    x = "Pace (Possessions per 48 minutes)",
    y = "Points Per Possession",
    caption = my_caption
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12),
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 1, size = 8)
  )

title: The Ravens struggle in the playoffs
text:
Ravens struggle in the playoffs despite regular season success.
